title: 'Putin wasn't 'honest': US imposes heavy sanctions on Russian oil firms; what triggered Trump?
content: The United States is imposing significant sanctions on Russia's top oil firms, Rosneft and Lukoil, due to President Putin's perceived lack of honest engagement in peace talks with President Trump. This action follows the collapse of ceasefire discussions and the cancellation of a planned Trump-Putin summit, signaling US frustration over the stalled peace negotiations.

title: 'Down to nothing by year end': Trump's another crude claim on India's Russian oil imports
content: US President claims India will significantly reduce its Russian oil purchases by year-end, stating it's a gradual process. He also discussed China's relationship with Russia, suggesting it was forced by the previous administration and expressing hope for dialogue on ending the war in Ukraine.

title: Delhi encounter: 4 Bihar-based criminals gunned down in joint police operation
content: Four men wanted in Bihar for murder and other serious offenses were killed in an early morning encounter with Delhi Police and Bihar Police. The suspects allegedly opened fire when intercepted, leading to retaliatory action. At least two to three officers were injured during the operation.

title: 'He‚Äôs out of rhythm' ‚Äì Ex-India cricketer delivers harsh verdict on Virat Kohli
content: Virat Kohli's familiar struggle with deliveries outside off stump resurfaced in the first ODI against Australia, leading to a duck. Former player Mohammad Kaif attributes this to a lack of match practice, impacting Kohli's rhythm and anticipation. Despite this setback, Kohli aims to find form at Adelaide Oval, a venue where he has a strong record.

title: How to install OpenAI's ChatGPT Atlas browser: A step-by-step guide
content: OpenAI has rolled out ChatGPT Atlas, a new AI-powered browser for macOS users, integrating ChatGPT's capabilities directly into web browsing. This free tool allows users to access AI assistance across all tabs, remember browsing context, and automate tasks without leaving their current page. Atlas offers features like real-time page understanding and personalized suggestions. Users can import data from Chrome and set Atlas as their default browser, receiving enhanced rate limits for a week.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today ‚Äî Check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Navin Fluorine International, Lloyds Metals And Energy, and Bank of Maharashtra are recommended as top buy calls by Aakash K Hindocha. Nifty has broken out of a cup and handle formation, targeting 26200, while Bank Nifty hit fresh all-time highs, with upside potential to 58650.

title: IND vs AUS: Rohit ‚Äòdeliberately underperforming‚Äô under Gill? India legend fires back
content: India's openers struggled in their first ODI against Australia, with Rohit Sharma scoring eight and Virat Kohli a duck. Speculation arose on social media about deliberate underperformance to challenge new captain Shubman Gill. However, Sunil Gavaskar dismissed these theories, emphasizing that players wouldn't risk their careers and highlighting the benefit of experienced leaders for Gill.

title: Bhai Dooj 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes to share with your loved ones
content: Bhai Dooj, celebrated two days after Diwali, honors the strong bond between brothers and sisters. This year, it falls on October 22, with sisters praying for their brothers' well-being and brothers pledging protection. The festival is a time for joy, gifts, and cherishing lifelong connections, even across distances.

title: ChatGPT gets browser: Google loses $150B; Chrome monopoly threat
content: OpenAI's new AI browser, ChatGPT Atlas, has shaken the tech world.  The launch caused a massive $150 billion drop in Alphabet's market value.  CEO Sam Altman called it a rare chance to redefine web browsing.  Atlas integrates ChatGPT directly, allowing AI to perform tasks.  This poses a significant challenge to Google's search advertising revenue.  Investors are watching closely as Google also integrates AI into its Chrome browser.  The competition for browser dominance is heating up.

title: Flying with a power bank? New rules could ground your gadget
content: India is considering stricter rules for power banks on flights after a recent incident on an IndiGo flight. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation is reviewing technical inputs as foreign airlines like Emirates and Singapore Airlines have already implemented restrictions on power bank usage and charging onboard.

title: UP: BJP neta makes trader rub nose on road over parking row; arrested
content: A BJP office bearer in Meerut was arrested and removed from his post after forcing a businessman to publicly apologize by rubbing his nose on the road. The incident, captured on video, occurred outside a UP minister's office. Three police personnel present at the scene were also shunted for inaction.

title: Zuckerberg‚Äôs Superintelligence Labs cuts 600 staff after offering $100M+ AI pay packages
content: Meta's Superintelligence Labs, recently in the news for offering $100 million AI researcher packages, has now laid off 600 employees.  Chief AI officer Alexandr Wang stated the move aims for agility and impact, with affected North American staff notified. Meta insists this doesn't signal reduced investment, vowing to continue hiring top AI talent to accelerate progress towards superintelligence.

title: Aaron Rodgers reacts hilariously after Steelers player tackles him mid-celebration
content: Steelers' Broderick Jones accidentally tackled Aaron Rodgers during a touchdown celebration, leading to a humorous exchange. Rodgers, unfazed, playfully warned his teammate about future collisions. Jones, embracing the moment, vowed to bring similar energy. This incident highlights the developing camaraderie within the team, even as Rodgers proves his enduring skill on the field.

title: 'Blot on humanity': Ill Dalit man made to lick urine after soiling temple stairs in UP
content: A 65-year-old Dalit man, suffering from illness, was allegedly forced to lick his own urine and clean temple stairs in Lucknow after an accident. The jewellery shop owner, Swami Kant, was arrested following a complaint. The incident has sparked outrage and calls for stringent action against caste-based humiliation.

title: Stephen and Ayesha Curry divorce rumours denied after viral podcast remarks
content: Recent rumors of a Stephen and Ayesha Curry divorce were fueled by Ayesha's "Call Her Daddy" podcast comments about not wanting marriage or children. However, no evidence supports these claims, as their social media shows continued affection and family photos. Steph recently posted a tribute to Ayesha, calling her his 'rock'.

title: Knicks vs Cavaliers injury update: Hart, Robinson out; Towns uncertain
content: The NBA season kicks off with the New York Knicks hosting the Cleveland Cavaliers on October 22, 2025. Both teams face significant injury concerns, with the Knicks missing key players like Mitchell Robinson and Karl-Anthony Towns. The Cavaliers will also be without Darius Garland. Despite roster challenges, both sides aim for a strong opening performance at Madison Square Garden.

title: Daniel Naroditsky net worth 2025: Chess grandmaster‚Äôs income, death & legacy
content: Chess world mourns Daniel Naroditsky, a beloved American grandmaster and online teacher. Naroditsky, known for his clear lessons, died at 29. His estimated net worth in 2025 was one million dollars. He inspired countless players globally through YouTube, Twitch, and coaching. His passing leaves a void in the chess community, remembered for making the game accessible and enjoyable for all.

title: Bihar polls: Tejashwi oppn's CM face? Answers at presser today, say INDIA allies
content: Tejashwi Yadav's declaration as the INDIA bloc's CM face in Bihar is imminent following crucial meetings between Congress leaders and RJD's Lalu Prasad. Allies express confidence in Tejashwi's leadership, with an official announcement expected soon. Congress assures unity and a strong electoral front for Bihar.

title: Choksi extradition: Swish prison cell awaits bizman ‚Äî Inside Mumbai‚Äôs Arthur Road jail
content: Fugitive Mehul Choksi's extradition to India will see him housed in a specially prepared cell at Arthur Road jail, designed to meet European prisoner standards.  Photographs reveal a surprisingly well-equipped dwelling with ample light, ventilation, and amenities, countering claims of poor jail conditions. This development follows a Belgian court's decision to uphold his extradition.

title: 'If you want trophy': New twist in Asia Cup row; Naqvi sends stern message to BCCI
content: A dispute has erupted between the BCCI and PCB over the Asia Cup trophy presentation. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi insists on personally handing the trophy to India in Dubai on November 10, following India's refusal to accept it from him after their win. This stems from tensions between the Indian team and the ACC president.

title: Staggered pan-India SIR likely in a week, 3 months for each phase
content: A nationwide special intensive revision of electoral rolls is set to begin within days, mirroring Bihar's successful three-month process. This significant undertaking, the first in over two decades, aims to update voter lists across India. States facing immediate assembly polls will be prioritized, with a final roll expected by early next year.

title: 'Insult to Hindus': BJP after Kali idol 'desecrated' in Bengal; taken away in prison van
content: Desecration of a Goddess Kali idol in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district sparked outrage, with the BJP accusing the TMC government of shielding culprits. Police are investigating the damaged idol, found in a village temple, and warned against misinformation. The incident occurred amidst protests and stone-pelting, leading to police intervention.

title: Louvre loot: Who buys a stolen crown? Inside the global black market for royal jewels
content: Four thieves executed a swift heist at the Louvre, stealing $102 million in crown jewels. Experts warn the real crime is the impending dismantling and sale of these historical treasures on the black market. This brazen theft highlights a growing international criminal economy targeting cultural heritage for its commodity value, making recovery unlikely.

title: Sarfaraz's snub turns political: BJP hits back - ' Desh ka partition karke mann nahi bhara'
content: Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed accused India head coach Gautam Gambhir of religious bias in team selection after Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion from the India 'A' squad. BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla strongly refuted the allegations, calling them divisive. Sarfaraz Khan has a strong first-class record and recently scored a century in his last international series.

title: 'Pakistan Zindabad': Fan shouts at Shubman Gill; Captain handles it perfectly - watch
content: Indian ODI captain Shubman Gill encountered a surprising moment in Australia. A fan, during a handshake, shouted 'Pakistan Zindabad'. Gill appeared momentarily stunned and then continued his walk. The incident, captured on video, has circulated widely online. The Indian team is currently in Australia for an ODI series. Gill is focused on the upcoming match.

title: Clearing the air: Delhi's AQI 2000+ or under 400? Why apps show different figures
content: Delhi residents were confused by vastly different pollution readings on Tuesday. While India's CPCB showed AQI below 400, international apps like IQAir reported over 2,000. Experts explain these discrepancies stem from different calculation methods and data sources, though both indicate dangerously poor air quality post-Diwali.

title: Women's WC: Gardner's ton fires Australia to six-wicket win over England
content: Australia continued their unbeaten streak in the Women's World Cup, defeating England by six wickets. Annabel Sutherland and Ashleigh Gardner starred with an unbeaten 180-run partnership, chasing down England's 244. Sutherland narrowly missed a century with 98*, while Gardner remained not out on 104, securing a dominant victory and reclaiming the top spot.

title: President Murmu first woman head of state to offer prayers at Sabrimala‚Äî See pics and videos
content: President Droupadi Murmu made history by becoming the first woman head of state to offer prayers at the Sabarimala Ayyappa temple. Dressed in black, she followed traditional rituals, including carrying the sacred 'irumudikkettu'. President Murmu‚Äôs visit holds particular significance as it comes years after the Sabarimala temple became the centre of intense debate and protests over women‚Äôs entry.

title: Louvre heist: Museum director admits 'insufficient' camera coverage
content: Louvre director admits security camera flaws after $100 million jewel heist. Thieves exploited blind spots, bypassing aging perimeter cameras. Despite functioning alarms, the museum's external surveillance is deemed "highly insufficient." The incident has sparked a review of security measures at the iconic institution, with investigations ongoing to apprehend the culprits.

title: Mid-air scare: IndiGo flight suffers fuel leak; makes emergency landing in Varanasi
content: An IndiGo flight from Kolkata to Srinagar, Flight 6E-6961, made an emergency landing in Varanasi due to a detected fuel leak. All 166 passengers and crew were safely evacuated without injuries. Airport operations have resumed as authorities investigate the cause of the leak.

title: Railways may allow rescheduling of e-tickets without extra cost- how would it work
content: Indian Railways is set to introduce a new feature allowing passengers to change their confirmed e-ticket journey dates without cancellation or extra charges. This initiative, expected early next year, aims to enhance passenger convenience by enabling date modifications directly through the IRCTC website or app, subject to seat availability.

title: Lamar Jackson fires back at Dov Kleiman‚Äôs viral post, calls him ‚Äòweirdo‚Äô
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson publicly rebuked a viral NFL content creator for a misleading post, highlighting team struggles amid a 1-5 start.  Injuries and inconsistent play plague Baltimore, with a crucial home game against the Bears looming. Jackson's return is vital as the team desperately seeks a turnaround, facing immense pressure to silence off-field drama and refocus on the field.

title: 'Mungeri Lal ke sapne': Chirag Paswan hits out at Mahagathbandhan over 'ongoing infighting'
content: Chirag Paswan launched a scathing attack on the Mahagathbandhan, declaring it has collapsed and their power aspirations are mere "Mungeri Lal ke sapne." He questioned the alliance's coordination, specifically targeting Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav. Paswan also defended Chief Minister Nitish Kumar against personal attacks, highlighting the NDA's unity and focus on development.

title: Clippers vs Jazz preview: Date, time, where to watch, expected lineup & prediction
content: The Utah Jazz will host the Los Angeles Clippers on Wednesday, October 22, to tip off the 2025-26 NBA season at Delta Center. The Jazz, coming off a rebuilding year, face questions about their progress, while the Clippers boast an experienced core aiming to contend. This matchup offers an early glimpse into both teams' potential.

title: Edgecombe's 34 most in debut since Wilt in '59
content: Sixers rookie VJ Edgecombe lit up the Celtics with 34 points on Wednesday night, the most in an NBA debut since Wilt Chamberlain had 43 in 1959, as the Sixers won 117-116.

title: Vols' Vitello makes MLB history as Giants skipper
content: Tennessee coach Tony Vitello has been named the new manager of the San Francisco Giants, the team announced Wednesday.

title: Fields shrugs off Jets owner's criticism of his play
content: Jets quarterback Justin Fields shrugged off criticism from team owner Woody Johnson, saying he's not seeking a conversation to clear the air.

title: Payton: No intent to offend Wilson with comment
content: Broncos coach Sean Payton said he didn't mean to criticize Russell Wilson by saying he had told Giants officials that he had hoped to face him instead of Jaxson Dart

title: Rodgers says playing Pack 'not a revenge game'
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers said Wednesday that facing the Packers on Sunday night "is not a revenge game for me."

title: Source: Brondello set to coach expansion Tempo
content: Sandy Brondello, who has won two WNBA championships as head coach, has agreed to become the first coach of the expansion Toronto Tempo, a source told ESPN.

title: LeBron helps Lakers dissect opening-night loss
content: Coach JJ Redick said LeBron James, who missed the opener because of sciatica, was an important voice as the Lakers sifted through the tape Wednesday.

title: 'Born to do this': Suzuki gets 1-year Angels deal
content: Kurt Suzuki has only a one-year deal to be the new manager of the Angels, but he said he's excited to prove himself and that he was "born to do this."

content: It is learnt that External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar will represent India at the meetings; ASEAN summit will be held in Kuala Lumpur from October 26 to 28

content: ‚ÄòThe key scientific question is understanding solar eruptions, such as solar flares and coronal mass ejections, and their potential impact on space assets like satellites orbiting earth,‚Äô Vaibhav Pant, scientist at the Aryabhata Research Institute of Observational Sciences (ARIES), said

content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin will present the award which carries a cash prize of ‚Çπ5 lakh, a citation and a medal.

title: Nearly 35% of Chennai Metro Rail‚Äôs tunnelling completed in city for phase II project
content: Officials said, the underground construction is gradually picking up pace and this month alone, three tunnels‚Äîbetween Greenways Road and Mandaveli, Royapettah and Dr. Radhakrishnan Salai and Panagal Park to Kodambakkam‚Äîfinished their journeys.

title: Depositors of MHPFNL want State government to intervene and recover money
content: The association called for rapid recovery of assets and properties acquired using the depositors‚Äô money and full repayment of the principal along with accumulated interest.¬†

title: IndiGo plane enroute to Srinagar lands in Varanasi after fuel leak alert; all 166 passengers safe
content: All 166 passengers on board were reported to be safe and were escorted to the arrival hall soon after landing, they said

title: Mega investment project for electric vehicle manufacturing coming up in Rajasthan
content: The plant, to be established at 65.56 acres of land, will play a crucial role in supplying affordable e-buses all over the country and promote the renewable energy sector

title: TMC says Union Govt not releasing funds to West Bengal amounts to deliberate financial strangulation
content: The West Bengal‚Äôs ruling party said that while funds have been made available to Maharashtra and Karnataka to douse their flood crisis, yet left food ravaged West Bengal has been left out in the cold.

title: Eyeing investment push, U.P. Government to open satellite investment promotion offices in five metro cities
content: U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has already approved the proposal for restructuring ‚ÄòInvest U.P.‚Äô

title: EC cancels nomination of RJD leader Shweta Suman
content: Suman‚Äôs nomination was rejected after the Commission found that she was a resident of Uttar Pradesh, making her ineligible to contest the election.

title: Protests erupt in West Bengal‚Äôs Kakdwip over ‚Äòdesecrated idol‚Äô
content: Leaders of the West Bengal BJP made serious allegations about the desecration of the idol, demanding immediate arrests and a probe into ‚Äúadministrative negligence.‚Äù

title: Fadnavis warns of strict action after namaz video sparks Shaniwar Wada row in Pune
content: Three women are booked under AMASR Rules for offering namaz inside Pune‚Äôs historic fort, Shaniwar Wada. ¬†

title: Mohan Majhi govt. hands over recruitment scam probe to CBI
content: Since roots of the scam may extend beyond Odisha to Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, and other States, CBI is the right agency to probe the scam, says Odisha govt.

title: As talks on Ladakh resume, Centre offers special provisions under Article 371
content: Home Ministry makes proposal in fresh talks with Leh, Kargil civil society groups, who continue to demand Sixth Schedule status, Statehood; groups also demand release of Sonam Wangchuk, other detained protesters

title: Uproar over elder from SC community forced to lick ground as Opposition alleges display of casteism
content: 60-year-old man from the Scheduled Caste community was forced to lick the ground near Sheetla Maataa Mandir in Kakori area on the outskirts of the State capital on Deepavali after accidentally urinating near the temple; Congress and AAP call for justice for victim

title: Ahead of pan-India SIR, Election Commission tracks voter mapping progress
content: The exercise involves standardising addresses and correcting discrepancies through house-to-house visits by booth-level officers

title: Tejashwi, Tej Pratap are poles apart in tough battle for neighbouring seats
content: One brother has the family‚Äôs support and the other is on his own; their father Lalu Prasad‚Äôs name stands Tejashwi in good stead in Raghopur, but Tej Pratap, candidate of his own party after being disowned by parents and ousted from the RJD, faces a mounting challenge in Mahua constituency

title: Political row erupts in U.P. over Adityanath‚Äôs ‚Äòhalal certification‚Äô remarks
content: Opposition accuses Chief Minister of attempting to polarise voters, divert focus from jobs and economy

title: ‚ÄòLight a lamp‚Äô campaign held in Bengaluru for fair investigation into Dharmasthala case
content: The organisers will also start a letter-writing campaign in November to further spread awareness on the demands of the campaign

title: Ruckus on Akasa flight: Drunk man fights co-passengers; removed by crew
content: an alleged inebriated person created ruckus on Akasa's Bengaluru-Delhi flight . sources say he got into a spat with co-passengers and crew . he had to be physically taken out of the aircraft .

title: Internal rift in grand alliance in Bihar, says BJP
content: BJP national spokesperson claims a rift in Bihar‚Äôs grand alliance hinders candidate selection, while highlighting NDA‚Äôs women empowerment initiatives

title: Show cause notices issued to nearly 1,000 West Bengal BLOs unwilling to participate in electoral process
content: BLOs refusing to participate in the electoral process have cited security reasons; they have been directed to reply within 72 hours of receiving the notice from the Chief Electoral Officer

content: Total arrests rise to three; political parties continue protests over women‚Äôs safety and attacks on medical professionals in West Bengal

title: Frequent disruption of LPG cylinder supply worries households
content: In the latest incident, cylinder movement to six districts was affected as the drivers stayed away from work following a strike at BPCL LPG bottling plant at Ambalamedu

content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said details will be shared once the draft bills are approved by the state cabinet

content: Congress skips the meeting for coalition partners chaired by NC chief Farooq Abdullah and CM Omar Abdullah; ruling party battles with MP Ruhullah‚Äôs decision to keep away from campaigns

title: NHAI to deploy 3D sensors to identify potholes, road cracks across 23 States
content: Data shall be collected for all projects involving two- to eight-lane highways by deploying vehicles equipped with advanced sensors and data acquisition systems

content: A light spell of rain on October 22 evening also could have contributed to an improvement in air quality as fewer people were seen bursting fire crackers compared to the previous two days

title: NSCN (I-M) leader Muivah returns home in Manipur after six decades
content: The State government had thwarted his earlier attempt to visit Somdal village in Ukhrul district in 2010

title: Watch: IT Ministry proposes strict rules for labelling deepfakes amid AI misuse
content: The Indian government has proposed new rules to regulate AI-generated content, requiring mandatory labeling and permanent metadata for deepfakes and synthetic media.

content: Marripadu records 89.5 mm rain; NDRF and SDRF teams stationed in Nellore, Prakasam, Kadapa and Tirupati districts, says Home Minister

content: Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi says it is ironic to see the anti-corruption body ordering BMWs for its members and the guardians of integrity chasing luxury over legitimacy

title: Weather system over Bay of Bengal unlikely to intensify; Heavy rains to persist over north Tamil Nadu this week
content: The northeast monsoon in its vigorous mode pounded most districts across the State. Periyakalapet in Puducherry recorded extremely heavy rainfall of 25 cm in the 24 hours ending 8:30 a.m. on October 22

content: They mark the first-ever uniform framework for all Urban Local Bodies and Urban Development Authorities, replacing multiple master plans that have long caused ambiguity and procedural delays ¬†

content: The hamlet is reachable only by crossing four streams that overflow during the October‚ÄìJanuary monsoon season. With the streams in spate, movement has become impossible

content: The August 12, 2025 notification allows for the cancellation of Overseas Citizenship of India status if a cardholder is chargesheeted for an offence carrying a sentence of seven years or more, even without a conviction

content: Sharaf Group expresses willingness to invest in logistics and warehouses in A.P., while Transworld Group is keen to partner in setting up shipbuilding unit at Dugarajapatnam

title: Landing of President‚Äôs helicopter  on newly-laid turf triggers row
content: The chopper had originally been scheduled to land at Nilakkal, but unfavourable weather forced a last-minute change. Officials clarified that the helipad had been completed only hours before the President‚Äôs arrival, and its surface had not fully set due to damp weather

title: Great Green Wall to protect Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs coastline from cyclones and environmental degradation
content: An initiative of the Department of Environment, Forests, Science & Technology, the project spanning 5 km will comprise a multi-layered green buffer zone having mangroves, shelterbelt plantations, inland vegetation, and sand dunes that will reduce the impact of cyclones and storm surges, and stabilise shorelines

title: Congress comes down on LDF over move to join PM-SHRI scheme
content: AICC general secretary alleges that CPI(M) is deviating from its professed principles by supporting the PM-SHRI scheme

title: No accurate data on number of migrant workers in State
content: Unified portal and mobile application and Kerala Interstate Migrant Workers Welfare Registration Ordinance still being readied

title: CPI State executive weighs the ‚Äòpros and cons‚Äô of signing up for the NEP-linked PM-SHRI scheme
content: Party feels the LDF government should be wary of rising to the Centre‚Äôs ‚ÄúNEP bait. States that committing to PM-SHRI will implicitly signal adherence to the NEP, which infringes on federalism and, at a stroke, negates cultural, ethnic and linguistic diversities by seeking to centralise school education

title: NIMHANS launches new video series on mental health
content: The series on YouTube features mental health professionals from NIMHANS, offering valuable insights into a range of mental health conditions.

title: Over 130 cracker-related eye injury cases reported in Bengaluru; majority among children
content: Doctors said they are expecting more cases on Wednesday (October 22) night as it is the last day of the festivities.

title: President to  visit Kottayam on Thursday
content: President Droupadi Murmu will be the chief guest of the valedictory ceremony of the platinum jubilee of St. Thomas Autonomous College, Pala

title: Majority of wellness Ayurveda players outside Kerala Tourism‚Äôs classification
content: Only less than 60 players have registered with the department, while over 150 are actively operating in the sector in Kerala without any classification

title: From braying to bye-ing: MP loses 94% of donkeys in 3 decades; now just 3,000 left
content: the state now has just 3,052 donkeys, a sharp fall from 49,289 in 1997 . nine of the 55 districts have reported zero donkey, signalling near-total disappearance of the animal that once powered rural India‚Äôs transport and trade . animal rights activist Naresh Kadyan had urged the Centre to declare donkey hide an endangered species .

title: "It's A Process": Trump Reiterates Claim On India's Russian Oil Imports Amid New Sanctions
content: US President Donald Trump has reiterated his claim that New Delhi has assured him that India will curb its Russian oil imports, citing a personal assurance from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: 4 Most-Wanted Gangsters From 'Sigma Gang' Killed In Delhi Encounter
content: Four most wanted gangsters from Bihar were killed in a police encounter in Delhi early Thursday. They were wanted criminals in several heinous cases in Bihar.

title: Temple Ex-Official Arrested As Probe Continues In Sabarimala Gold Theft Case
content: The former administrative officer of the Sabarimala temple was arrested by the Special Investigation Team (SIT) in connection with the misappropriation of gold plating from Lord Ayyappa's sacred shrine.

title: "President Is Disappointed": US Sanctions Russia's 2 Largest Oil Firms
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced new sanctions Wednesday against Russia's two biggest oil companies and blasted Moscow's refusal to end its "senseless war."

title: SC/ST Act Can't Be Used To Curtail Bank's Mortgage Rights: Delhi Court
content: The Delhi High Court has said that the provisions of the SC/ST Act relating to wrongful occupation or dispossession of land belonging to people from SC and ST cannot be used to prevent a bank from exercising its lawful mortgage rights.

title: Cow Vigilante Allegedly Shot In Hyderabad, BJP Leaders Condemn Attack
content: A cow vigilante, Sonu, was allegedly shot by a cow smuggling mafia in the Ghatkesar area of Hyderabad on Wednesday.

title: UP Man Kills Wife Over Alleged Affair, Burries Body Inside House; Arrested
content: A 48-year-old man who allegedly killed his wife over an illicit relationship and buried her body inside their house in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district has been arrested, police said on Wednesday.

title: Trinamool To Launch Anti-SIR Campaign In West Bengal
content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) is planning to hold a massive rally in Kolkata against the proposed Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal.

title: We Failed: Louvre Director Admits Inadequate Camera Surveillance After Heist
content: The director of the Louvre on Wednesday admitted to inadequate camera surveillance of the museum's outside walls, three days after thieves robbed it of prize jewels in a brazen daytime heist.

title: Trump To Meet China's Xi In South Korea, Cancels Meeting With Russia's Putin
content: United States President Donald Trump on Wednesday (local time) announced his upcoming diplomatic trip to Malaysia, South Korea, and Japan, highlighting a significant meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea.

title: Video: US Kills 2 In Strike On Alleged Drug Boat, This Time In Pacific Ocean
content: The US military launched its eighth strike against an alleged drug-carrying vessel, killing two people in the waters of the eastern Pacific Ocean, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Wednesday.

title: COVID-19 Vaccines May Help Some Cancer Patients Fight Tumours
content: The most widely used COVID-19 vaccines may offer a surprise benefit for some cancer patients  revving up their immune systems to help fight tumours.

title: Driver Who Kidnapped, Murdered 5-Year-Old Boy In Delhi Arrested: Cops
content: A man who allegedly kidnapped a five-year-old boy in outer Delhi's Narela area and murdered him in what appears to be a revenge killing has been arrested, police said on Wednesday.

title: Trump Says US Has Not Approved Ukraine's Use Of Long-Range Missiles
content: US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that a news report on the United States giving approval to Ukraine to use long-range missiles deep into Russia was false, adding the U.S. "has nothing to do with those missiles."

title: "Thug": War Of Words Between Trump, Colombia President Intensifies
content: Donald Trump and the president of Colombia engaged in a war of words on Wednesday, trading threats of "very serious action" and lawsuits as relations between the once-allied nations hit a new low.

title: Woman, Daughter Among 4 Run Over By Train While Crossing Track In Bihar
content: Four people, including a woman and her daughter, were run over by a train in Bihar's Begusarai district as they were trying to cross the tracks late on Wednesday night, an official said.

title: Trump Says Xi Jinping Could Have "Big Influence" On Putin
content: President Donald Trump said Wednesday Xi Jinping could have a "big influence" on Russia's Vladimir Putin over efforts to end the war in Ukraine, days ahead of a meeting scheduled between the US and Chinese leaders in South Korea.

title: PM Modi Likely To Skip ASEAN Summit In Malaysia
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is unlikely to travel to Malaysia to participate in the meetings related to the ASEAN summit beginning Sunday due to scheduling issues, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

title: North Korea Has Stolen Billions In Crypto, Tech Firm Salaries: Report
content: North Korean hackers have pilfered billions of dollars by breaking into cryptocurrency exchanges and creating fake identities to get remote tech jobs at foreign companies, according to an international report on North Korea's cyber capabilities.

title: EU Agrees New Russia Sanctions Over Ukraine War
content: The EU on Wednesday agreed to impose new sanctions on Russia over the war in Ukraine aimed at crimping Moscow's oil and gas revenues, said Denmark, which holds the EU's rotating presidency.

title: 'Waging war on our border': US strikes 'drug-smuggling' boat in Pacific; 2 killed
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Himachal shivers: Mercury drops after fresh snow, rain; Tabo below 0¬∞
content: tabo in lahaul & Spiti district was the coldest at minus 0.7 degrees Celsius . manali recorded a minimum temperature of 7.4 degrees, Shimla and Dharamshala 12.6 degrees each, and Kufri 10.9 degrees .

title: MAGA nativists embrace darkness of racism over White House Diwali
content: hysteria underlines growing hostility towards immigrants and foreigners in nativist circles in America . many of them Christian nationalists berated the Trump on social media after he lit a Diwali diya (lamp) in the white house .

title: Tullis-Joyce's rise to USWNT, Man United No. 1 (via a rainforest)
content: the summer break offers the opportunity to jet off to glitzy locations like Ibiza or Dubai . the 29-year-old goalkeeper is a real fan favorite at the club . she has been working with a researcher called Dr. Rosa V√°squez Espinoza .

title: PM may skip Asean summit: No Modi-Trump meeting soon; govt denies Pak talk on call with US president
content: despite the recent show of bonhomie between PM Narendra Modi and president Donald Trump, India and the US seemed at odds over talks between the leaders . it‚Äôs also learnt that India is exploring the possibility of Modi addressing the Asean/ East Asia summit meetings in Malaysia virtually later this week . this would rule out any likelihood in the near future of an in-person encounter with Trump .

title: Power Rankings: Alabama climbs into the top 5; four new teams join the list
content: Georgia quarterback Gunner Stockton delivers in a big moment once again in the win over the Rebels . the bulldogs are gaining steam in the college football playoff race . a team of top players is gaining momentum in college football .

title: 'He's in final stage of career': Sidda's son amid K'taka CM row; names successor
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Ranking every open Power 4 job in college football
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . no coach is safe, but a strong line of storms has been forecasted . a total of 298-150 coaches have been fired from the power conference .

title: WNBA coaching tracker for 2026: Toronto Tempo hire Sandy Brondello
content: the expansion Toronto Tempo and Portland Fire join the WNBA next year . the franchise will have an international coach to launch the team . Brondello is a native of australia who has two decades of coaching experience in the league . she has been a head coach for 13 seasons and an assistant for eight seasons .

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: a year ago, the WNBA players' association announced the players would opt out of their current collective bargaining agreement with the league that was set to expire following the 2025 season . the players outlined their desire for a new economic model based on equity . there are no signs a deal will be put in place by the date that the current deal expires, on Oct. 31 .

title: Ranking the 6 UFC championship fights still to come in 2025
content: Tom Aspinall will defend his undisputed heavyweight title against former interim titleholder Ciryl Gane . Virna Jandiroba will meet Mackenzie Dern for the 115-pound title that Zhang Weili vacated earlier this year to move up to flyweight . the co-main event also finds Zhang trying to become a flyweight champion .

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Bo Nix, downgrade Quinshon Judkins
content: the matchup rankings provide a schedule-independent method to evaluate positional matchups each week . we calibrate points-allowed data to show how each defense fared relative to the difficulty of the schedule it has faced . "adj. FPA," or adjusted fantasy points allowed, reflects how fa .

title: The chaos of the U.S. Open Cup: Why Sharktopus gets a rematch
content: 'Futbol Americas' team debate who's the leading contenders to win the MLS cup . the team looked a little too friendly with the referee during the second round match . a video of him playing for Bellevue's reserve team, B2 was found on his Instagram page .

title: Where Dodgers-Blue Jays ranks among best World Series matchups since 2000
content: Los Angeles Dodgers and the Toronto Blue Jays will have an epic World Series . none of the past five World Series went longer than six games . the blue Jays are hoping to become the first repeat champion in 25 years .

title: Isak's exit leaves room for Ekitike to be Liverpool's main man
content: arne slot's side ended their losing streak with a 5-1 victory in the champions league . the win answered most of the questions being asked of the premier league champions . but the downside of the performance at Deutsche Bank Park was the 45-minute no-show of Alexander Isak .

title: Which NHL teams have the most to prove in 2025-26? Placing 13 teams into tiers
content: few teams in NHL history have proved themselves in the face of doubters more than the Florida Panthers of the past few seasons . this season will be defined by the teams outside of South Florida that need to do a lot of proving of their own .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 8
content: a team with Would be in status is featured in this week's top-12 projection . teams with Work to do are the true bubble teams and the first ones outside the bracket . one team with work to do is passing the eye test and has a chance at winning its conference .

title: Army transforming its 382 infantry battalions with new weapons & drone platoons
content: the army is now progressively transforming its 382 infantry battalions to meet the myriad challenges of tech-driven warfare . focus is on lethality, mobility, battlefield transparency, situational awareness, survivability, training and restructuring . the infantry is by far the largest arm of the 11.5 lat.
